title: A rant to all High elo players.
body:
So lately I've been coming across a few diamonds and plats saying the usual following to me: 

"Since I am a higher elo then you, you have to respect me and all elo tiers that are above you." It literally takes me a good 10 seconds to realize that this guy was serious, and I get incredibly annoyed and pissed about it.

Your rank is your achievement to what YOU can accomplish. It is not a placement to whom you have to bow to and who you make bow to.   So what if you are diamond 2. Who cares!? You should be proud of yourself that you achieved so many wins from either yourself or with your friends. Instead of "asking" people to respect you. Why don't you actually EARN respect, by helping lower elo's with advice, or by being nice and friendly? It's not hard dammit! If you are the type that keeps to yourself then that's fine, just don't expect people to hand you a plate full of respect just because of how many wins you grabbed in ranked.

replies.body: Diamond rank in LoL is probably their greatest achievement in life if they act like that. Don't get riled up, just feel sorry for them.

Diamond is really my greatest achievement in my life... but im usually nice to lower ranking players and listen to their game knowledge too, just being higher doesnt mean you are better at everything. I read a lot about Malicious Metal's insight for example, a Mordekaiser main whose bby got ''changed''.
His'baby' got 'changed' as in the father(Riot) came out of nowhere gutted the baby then left it to die while giving the finger to the caretakers and family members(community and Morde mains)

Mordekasier Gutted?

Pass The Weed.

Meant SoloKaiser

*passes weed*

> [{quoted}](name=Jensus,realm=EUW,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=FlZAYOK2,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-08-24T23:49:32.432+0000)
>
> Diamond is really my greatest achievement in my life...

dear lord...  
http://i.imgur.com/pnotlnZ.gif
We hereby dub this "The Solo Queuer's Dilemma",

(I call mid first in blind pick, most other roles are then called)

Guy comes in - ( "oh sheet I don't want to support..." ) "I'm a Plat surf give me mid"

My response - "If you're plat that means you can play all the roles"

Gets them every time

in actuality the higher you go the more specialized most people become...

however that's not to say plat smurf should get mid, just that you're logic is a bit flawed
A bit flawed, yeah. It should be reasonable to expect that if someone is smurfing in a rank far below their actual rank, they can do at least more than one role.

Thing is, a diamond toplane/jungle main will get shit on if he plays his shit roles... in diamond. His supporting might be trash-tier in diamond but in vs golds it's probably pretty damn good. It's just that if you want a smurf to give you free LP then you give him his main role. Otherwise it really doesn't matter.
Specialized maybe, but a plat should still play his offroles better than a gold or silver just by way of knowing things like freezing lanes and objectives.

Yea i'm tired of getting rank bashed too. It's bad enough on boards, but now it's extended to games where I fail a gank on a Gold 4 Riven (my normals mmr is higher than my ranked) and they will type in /all "Bronze ganks are hilarious" and it just demoralizes the fuck out of me.

Bronze=Silver=Gold

Don't let a Gold player take you down. I have numerous Gold friends and they are good, but I could easily win a lane against them even though I'm Silver 4. And if your Normal MMR is higher, you should probably try to climb to get those sweet rewards. I got a friend who never ranked for a season and is now Diamond 4. I believe in you. :)
Some Diamond players don't understand the "You have to give respect to get respect" concept.
Yes, I completely agree to that. some high elos need to get off their high horse.
im diamond, ive tried giving advice. its usually taken the wrong way, and i get told to fuck off.

If you want to try and give advice I would recommend you talk to the the team
**Do:** We should do X because X
**for example:** We should build armor as they are mostly AD


**Don't:** You should build armor/X item

Referring to individual players directly usually cause more harm then good
http://data.whicdn.com/images/59590670/original.png

> [{quoted}](name=Lugg,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=FlZAYOK2,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-08-24T23:46:17.692+0000)
>
> *Some* diamond players don't understand the "You have to give respect to get respect" concept.

Ftfy. It's not like becoming diamond magically makes you a prick.
I don't think all high ELO players have that mentality, it's more of a stereotype.
Only a Bronze player would think like that kappa

I know you guys are going to downvote me to oblivion, but that's fine. 

I don't automatically demand respect as a diamond player, but if you're bronze and you're trying to argue a point to me then I am damn sure going to pull rank as an argument. Nowhere else does someone who is a novice win an argument with someone who is considered extremely good- their argument is validated by their clear amount of experience and game knowledge, which is displayed by that little icon that says "diamond" on their profile.

And while I'm at it, getting to diamond has been the absolute worst thing I could do to enjoy normal games. Anytime I lose lane, fuck up a gank, or move one hair out of place, I get asked where I bough my account and  how I got diamond if I'm such a shitter. Low elos talking shit to high elos is just as prevalent as what you're complaining about. I'm getting fucking sick of these circlejerk threads (ADCs are assholes, support power!, high elos should put up with everyone's bullshit, etc) that just exist to stereotype a specific part of the community. You guys are causing just as much negativity as the people you call out, and you're really **hurting** the situation if anything.

Ignoring something someone says purely based on rank isn't acceptable, but you bronze players need to get it through your heads that diamond players are just plain better than you at league, and their opinions should be weighted for more, just as a challenger's opinion is worth much more than my own. 

My goal really isn't to make anyone feel bad based on their rank, but at the same time I'm not going to sit here and let you guys perpetrate that high elos are doing all the bullshitting.

"And while I'm at it, getting to diamond has been the absolute worst thing I could do to enjoy normal games. Anytime I lose lane, fuck up a gank, or move one hair out of place, I get asked where I bough my account and how I got diamond if I'm such a shitter."

So we have the same situation although yours is prob with plat/gold/silver players whereas mine is with silver/bronze players. The second anyone in the game op.gg's me and sees me higher elo than everyone else in the game, I get blamed for everything. If we lose, my fault. If I die, I'm trash, even though my lane is 3v1 half the game. Not enough wards? Blame me for not having the map lit up when Im playing mid and not building a sightstone even though I'm higher elo....

I wish my normals MMR was actually correct and put me in gold/plat games more often because every single time its a silver game its either I carry and get flamed for beating on silvers or I go like 3/5/0 and get called a trash feeder who went negative to silvers when I had a bad game...

EDIT: After finishing reading your post, I love you.

> [{quoted}](name=Zyraa,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=FlZAYOK2,comment-id=000b0000,timestamp=2015-08-25T04:46:42.147+0000)
>

> EDIT: After finishing reading your post, I love you.

I love you too baby ;)

I just wanted to make a second post and elaborate on something I briefly mentioned.

I understand that there are unranked, Bronzies and Silver players who are pretty good at league of legends, but don't care about ranked mode. That's fine! You don't have to play ranked. Just know that there is a specific dichotomy in League for the "casuals" and the "try-hards"- normals vs ranked. The reason rank shaming exists is because it is a clearly definable, and sometimes the ONLY clearly definable, characteristic about a player's skill level. I can play like shit and you can go legendary, but at the end of the day the only thing people in our next games are going to see are our borders. Sad but true. 

If you want to be taken seriously, the tough love message I'm giving you is you have to rank up. It's not enough to know you're good if you want people to respect you more. If you don't care then being in low elo is fine, but if you want to garner instant and relatively undeniable sway, that icon with your ranking on it sure doesn't hurt.

If you're competitive, and I assume everyone in gameplay and balance at least would consider themselves somewhat competitive, then your rank in relation to discussion is important, because it shows you survived and thrived in a competitive environment and came out on top. You know the game well, and- again I stress this- you have a CLEARLY DEFINED WAY TO SHOW IT! 

That's all it is. While the results of one, three five, or fifty games may go one way, your ranking is always there and always available for people to see, and is a completely irrefutable testament to your skill and knowledge.

You want to be taken more seriously? Show me.

> I don't automatically demand respect as a diamond player, but if you're bronze and you're trying to argue a point to me then I am damn sure going to pull rank as an argument. 

A point isn't invalid simply because of the person who said it (or valid)
Someone claiming something without anything to prove/support it can be dismissed without proof

However the claim that Talon is best played as an assassin because he doesn't provide anything except damage (Is just as true/false regardless of who says it.. be it a bronze or a diamond player)
Then maybe higher elo players shouldn't be egotistical assholes about it.  Instead, calmly educate the lower elo players rather than raging that you are a god playing with peons.

true diamonds are much better then me mechanically (i simply cant beat plat+ players) however sometimes they legit do not know what there are talking about (or are trolling in which case fuck them) but think since they are diamond they think automatically what they say is correct. for example ive had a diamond player (i think he was a top main dont remember for sure) seriously tell me i should build hurricane on cait........................

yes high elo usually knows what they are talking about but they are usually very specialized  and i dont care your rank im not building a hurricane on cait i know ive gotten other bs 

just as an example i have a friend who is a much higher elo then me hes a jungle/top main i dont tell him how to jungle the only advice i offer him comes from the fact i read patch notes and he dose not. but he helps me with jungling gives me advice because he is a much much better jungler than i am......however i am a much better adc/mid laner than he is and besides pointing out positional misplays he dose not try and tell me how to mid or adc but actually ask me for advice on build/skill paths and play style

Well when I was good player I had the flip side of that, low elos think that just because I was master I could carry a game and never make a mistake. Everyone diamond+ knows the "lol this guy boosted" comment. Or when we try to help people just tell us to eat it. After awhile you get cynical.

Low elos shouldn't be thinking like that either. People Shouldn't expect perfect gameplay just because someone is higher elo. Cause they themselves NEED to step up and actually try to help out the ENTIRE team. The game is a team effort not a solo effort.

People need to learn that, if they want to stick to being solo then they can just play a differant moba game. Dota should be perfect for them cause it doesn't really need a team effort. ~shrug~

> Dota should be perfect for them cause it doesn't really need a team effort.

{{champion:48}} /10
Play Enigma, build Aganim's, be useless or 1v5 if they group.

The truth is, you're all scrubs.
Ghet gude before you try to form an opinion.

~Unranked master race.

> [{quoted}](name=GamerGoodies,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=FlZAYOK2,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-08-24T21:48:52.084+0000)
>
> So lately I've been coming across a few diamonds and plats saying the usual following to me: 
> 
> "Since I am a higher elo then you, you have to respect me and all elo tiers that are above you." It literally takes me a good 10 seconds to realize that this guy was serious, and I get incredibly annoyed and pissed about it.
> 
> Your rank is your achievement to what YOU can accomplish. It is not a placement to whom you have to bow to and who you make bow to.   So what if you are diamond 2. Who cares!? You should be proud of yourself that you achieved so many wins from either yourself or with your friends. Instead of "asking" people to respect you. Why don't you actually EARN respect, by helping lower elo's with advice, or by being nice and friendly? It's not hard dammit! If you are the type that keeps to yourself then that's fine, just don't expect people to hand you a plate full of respect just because of how many wins you grabbed in ranked.

I don't think they meant respect them as in worship them, but usually you should put more weight to a higher elo's opinion about the game because they have played at a higher level and usually have a lot more experience
Most diamond players (me included) are shit at the game anyway. Master Tier and up gets respect imo.
Why all high elo players? There are pricks in diamond+ just like every other elo, but that doesn't mean you need to generalize.

Lmao ikr!

_Climbs up on high horse and high fives_
It's really not cool to lump all the higher elo players in like that, we aren't ALLLL huge dicks.

Seriously anybody who does this is a fucking asshole. I have a well paying job with a good education, i support people financially. 
What have high ranking players actually done to earn respect? I mean sure a high rank to have in a game is nice and all but it shows nothing besides your competency within the game. Which is nothing to be respected, it can be admired and you can learn from a higher ranking player and become better, but that does not necessarily mean that they deserve respect from the get go. 
Who the hell knows who is behind the screen, might be a platinum player during the day but a **GIGALO** at night.

Also a lot of high ranking ppl are dicks from the get go.

Platinum players aren't good. I sometimes get matched into like low silver games when Im gold 3 instead of a gold/plat game (i play during the night quite often so that might contribute to why theres less lobbies to put me in) and immediately people are like oh shit gold 3 gg and ill be camped all game when Im really not a lot better than them, just like a plat player isn't much better than me. Some diamond players are actually really good, but thats no reason to respect someone.
Platinum players are certainly better than you at least, i mean they did make it to plat, and you did not.

Lel, this thread is hilarious. I'm sorry but if you play this game and play ranked then you obviously DO care about how your performance is on this game compared to others. If you didn't, you would be playing normals. The fact that you feel the need to drag someone down for being able to accomplish what you cannot is the truly sad thing, Not being in the top 1% of MILLIONS of people who play this game. I would take pride in that as well, beating out MILLIONS of other players is no small accomplishment. This game has lots of thought and strategy put into it and to be one of the best at it is actually quite an accomplishment. You are the same people who say "its not real life" and "its just a game" so that you don't have to face up to the fact that you want to be good at this game and simply are not. It is nothing more than your ego protecting itself. 

Guess what. It is a game. A game played by millions of people. A game that exsists in real life and people get payed and win real money to play it. Achieving a high rank in said game is REALLY a REAL accomplishment in the REAL world. All you people who justify your shitty plays and shitty elo with "its just a game" are just lying to yourselves. If thats how you feel stop playing ranked and go play normals where you can fuck around every game and not have to justify it to yourselves because you are mature enough to admit when you are bad at something but enjoy playing it anyway.
Amen.
You are an asshole if you were wondering. Condescension should be a sin.
I wasn't wondering. Could not care less what you think. Thanks for making a completely pointless post that has no substance or thought put into it though! keep that up!
IT wasn't pointless... and you do care.
Oh okay, what was the point you were making then? also what else am I thinking?
if you ever see someone telling you to respect them or rank, say you are a wood V smurf. wood V trumps all.
